abstract.p: CIE Tours International is offering spring discount tours to Scotland; Swan Hellenic is offering discounts on cruises aboard Minerva from March 2001 to January 2002; Fairmont Hotels is dropping rates up to 40 percent at four resorts in Quebec in time for fall foliage trips; Royal Air Maroc drops fall and winter fares to Morocco; drawing (M)

block.p: SCOTTISH SPRING -- CIE Tours International wants travelers to look ahead, in this case to the spring in Scotland, with savings of $419 to $439 on one-week escorted trips with air fare. Departures are April 7, 14, 21 and 28, with stops including Loch Lomond, the Isle of Skye, Fort William, Loch Ness, Glasgow and Edinburgh. Rates of $1,455 a person, double occupancy April 7 and 14, $1,475 April 21 and 28 (versus $1,894 in summer), include air fare from New York, Boston or Baltimore and daily breakfast, six dinners, bus and guide, admissions and local taxes. Typical hotels are the Hilton Grosvenor in Glasgow and the Ardoe House in Blairs. Call (800) 243-8687; www.cietours.com.

PLANNING WELL AHEAD -- Swan Hellenic offers savings of 10 to 25 percent on cruise fares aboard its 300-passenger Minerva from March 2001 to January 2002 for anyone who reserves by Oct. 30. In April, the Minerva sails the Mediterranean, then heads to the Baltic in early summer. Midsummer and autumn are spent back in the Mediterranean, with November in the Arabian Gulf and India. One-week Mediterranean fares, for example, start at $1,675 a person, double occupancy (versus $2,094 without the early-booking discount). These fares are subject to availability. Swan Hellenic also allows passengers up to age 26 to cruise at half fare when sharing a cabin with a passenger paying full fare. For information, call (877) 219-4239 or visit the Web site: www.swanhellenic.com.

AUTUMN IN QUEBEC -- Then there are times when spur-of-the-moment trips can yield bargains. Fairmont Hotels is dropping standard room rates up to 40 percent at four resorts in Quebec through Oct. 23, in time for impromptu fall foliage trips. At Le Chateau Frontenac in Quebec City, a one-night package with breakfast and audiotape walking tour starts at $237, at $1.50 Canadian to the U.S. dollar, for a double. At Le Manoir Richelieu in Charlevoix, a one-night golf package with greens fees and cart, buffet breakfast and dinner starts at $219, for a double. The Queen Elizabeth in Montreal has rates starting at $179 (with breakfast) or from $209 (with dinner in The Beaver Club). Montreal rates are good through April 30, 2001. Similar packages are available at Le Chateau Monticello. Tips are included, but not tax; (800) 441-1414 or www.fairmont.com.

MOROCCO BOUND -- Royal Air Maroc has dropped its fares to Morocco for the fall and winter from the summer rate of $1,010. A nonstop round trip between New York and Casablanca is $630 on weekends through Oct. 31, then it drops to $580 for midweek departures through Dec. 14. From Dec. 15 to Jan. 5, 2001, the fare is $670 midweek, $720 weekends; from Jan. 6 to March 21, $580 midweek and $630 weekends. These are coach fares for stays of a week to a month. Other restrictions apply; (800) 344-6726 or on the Web, www.royalairmaroc.com.
